intro: Astrotricha ledifolia var. hoveoides, commonly known as the Hovea aster. This variant is a flowering plant native to New Zealand, characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers and hairy foliage. It typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
